q: Replay Attack?
o: Attacker captures a valid data transmission (e.g. Login) and repeats it later to gain access. Nonces/Timestamps prevent this.

q: Symmetric Encryption?

q: Asymmetric Encryption?
o: Pair of keys (Public/Private). Public encrypts, Private decrypts (or vice versa for signing). Solving key distribution.

q: Hashing vs Encryption?
o: Hashing is One-Way (cannot reverse). Encryption is Two-Way (can decrypt with key). Passwords should be HASHED.
